header.title: The Esoteric Gnosis of Michael Bertiaux: Choronzon Club, Grimoire Ghuedhe, and Kami/Sun Goddess Initiations
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Gnostic Magic, Voudon Gnosis

central_thesis: The work presents a syncretic system for achieving higher states of spiritual awareness and power through gnostic initiation, integrating diverse magical traditions (Voudon, Shinto, Zothyrian). It emphasizes the transformation of the self, practical application of esoteric logic, and direct interaction with divine beings and subtle energies to unlock hidden realities, attain self-divinization, and master energetic realms.

structure_content.chapter_title: Gnostic Initiation and the Master's Prayer
structure_content.summary: Discusses the fundamental importance of gnostic initiation for accessing higher spiritual realms and understanding planetary energies. Introduces a powerful, ancient prayer used daily for spiritual awareness and diffusing cosmic light, taught by Master M.A. (Michael Aquarius) to enable students to embody gnostic powers.

Describes a personal statement of power and healing originating from the 'golden temple' in the mental plane, which is the source of power for the physical Sun. It elaborates on Master Michael Aquarius's role as a source of divine light and transformation, making practitioners 'gods.' An experiment using radionic instruments for Ojas activity is also detailed.

Explores the nature of the Golden Temple, its pure gold sanctuary, and a prayer for students to connect with the Master. Michael Aquarius is presented as a spiritual transformer sent by Gnostic Beings. Introduces 'Grimoire Ghuedhe' concepts related to sexual magic and Chinese-Gnostic algebra, hinting at diverse metaphysical frameworks.

Connects the concept of the Sun-Goddess (Amaterasu-Omikami/Ameratsu-Omni-Kami) from Japanese Shinto and Zothyrian theology as a central focus of power. Master M.A. is identified as a messenger of the Sun-Goddess, facilitating gnostic awakening. A powerful daily invocation to the Sun-Goddess for protection and power is provided.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Power and Rituals of the Kami
structure_content.summary: Defines Kami as the most powerful forces and divine embodiments in Shinto, equating them to the highest form of Vudu. Introduces a prayer for achieving unity with Kami ('Kami-hood') and exercises for 'Kami-energization.' Practical steps for a 'Kami-Ritual for Purity' are outlined, involving water, salt, and cloth, accompanied by specific prayers for self-purification and drawing Kami-energy.

structure_content.chapter_title: The High Energies of True Initiation-Consciousness
structure_content.summary: Discusses how holy beings of light guide initiation, emphasizing love and realizing oneself as part of the divine universe. Dr. Kammamori is introduced as a key teacher, bridging Japanese and Zothyrian traditions. The text delves into esoteric logic, contrasting the 'feminine aspect' (Voudoo, chaotic contents) with the 'masculine aspect' (Shinto Gnosis, structured logic), and their relation to Hegelian and Zen Buddhist thought.

Explores time zones, space-consciousness, and 'The Aiwaz Physics,' which utilizes the 'computer-marga' for field amplification. The concept of esoteric logicians within the 'Dainichi Revelations' is explained as a pathway for initiates to connect with these beings, leading to initiatic transformation through two laws of contact and radiation.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Pathway of The Lights of Wisdom
structure_content.summary: Introduces Master Sung-Po and his 'Legbha logicism' as the 'Root of Wisdom,' leading initiates to higher gnosis through theurgy. A basic Hoodoo ritual for gaining from spirits is provided. The 'Pathway of The Lights of Wisdom' describes an eight-step initiation process (numbers 9 to 1) for spiritual transformation and unification with divine light, culminating in entry into the 'Universe of Number 1'.

structure_content.chapter_title: Choronzon Club and the Nature of Chaos
structure_content.summary: Addresses the concept of 'psychic terror' and primordial chaos, which the Choronzon Club system aims to confront and transmute. Introduces 'Gnostic Hyperspatiality' and the Vudu God Legbha's role in granting access to higher hyperspace worlds and Vudotronic science. Key terms like 'Biquintility,' 'Gnostic Continuum,' and 'Pheonisme of Legbha' are defined in the context of advanced magical operations and the magician's evolution.

structure_content.chapter_title: The Hierarchy of Evil and Magickal Definitions
structure_content.summary: Asserts that 'Numbers of Evil' are agencies of evil and sources of universal wrongdoing within a specific ontological hierarchy. Introduces key concepts: 'Self-Pheonismes' (magician's projections of lust), 'Psionic' (etheric energy machine), 'Inner Legbha Geometry of the Hyperspatial Time' (Legbha as supreme deity and cosmic geometry), 'Stations and Gnostic Logics' (time-stations, logoi spermatikoi, Damballah), 'Time-Station Logic,' 'Les Vudu' (Atlantean Gods), 'La Couleuvre Noire' (Afro-Atlantean magicians), 'Presentements' (magickal objects as appearances), and 'Marmas' (body's power zones). The 'Act of Numbers' by M.P. Bertiaux explains numbers 1-9 as revelations of the Absolute and their relation to gnostic consciousness and 'Absoluteness'.

key_concepts.definition: The process of being physically and metaphysically imparted with keys to gnostic teachings, enabling deeper access to the consciousness of higher spiritual realms and understanding the expression of planetary energy.
A field of magical energy that can be localized and measured by radionic instruments, affected by amplification, and related to interaction between genital and cerebral chakras.

A very high structure in the mental plane, composed of fine golden mental matter, serving as the source of power for the physical Sun and where the master initiates students into the mysteries of being a master of the rays.

The Gods or Spirits of the Shinto Religion, representing the most powerful forces, pure embodiments of natural forces, divine intelligibility, and the highest, most complete form of the Cult of Vudu. They are also considered internal and inherent divinity within each person.
The process of becoming aware of and uniting with the powers of the Gods and spirits of the Esoteric Shinto Gnosis, allowing one to feel their presence and become one with them intuitively.

The central focus of power in Shinto and Zothyrian theology, from whom the human race is derived and dependent for life. Her divine presence is continuously radiated to the golden temple by Master M.A.

Emanations from the 'Dainichi Revelations' and beings who rise to self-consciousness through these revelations. They are Kami, or divine foci of consciousness (Kami-no-mamori), that develop structures of esoteric logic in the initiate's consciousness.

Teachings that condition and contain the existence of esoteric logicians, forming a world of its own that produces its own form of life and experience. Contact with them initiates a process of attunement to their lifestream.

The arche or essential law of absolute self-hood, realized through initiation and inner sciences like esoteric logic. It is the being behind all things, accessible to those initiated into the highest gnosis through theurgy, not just intuition.

key_concepts.term: Pathway of The Lights of Wisdom
key_concepts.definition: A Neo-Pythagorean-Gnostic initiation process structured into eight grades (numbers 9 to 1), where each step brings the student closer to unity with the Master's light and wisdom, culminating in the 'Universe of Number 1'.

A system and secret technique for confronting and transmuting primordial chaos and psychic terror, aimed at creating an 'other-selfhood' or 'alternative-ego' of pure magick, leading to creative freedom.

The higher spaces of gnostic magick where research and union with divine mysteries occur. It is here that Michael Bertiaux, with permission from Legbha, created magickal models like 'The Sun-Rays Divine Healing Home'.
A secret type of mathematical thinking underlying the science of Vudo-tronics, originating from Legbha and transmitted to Michael Bertiaux for the precise application of magick.
An astrological term (144 degrees with 3-degree orb) that indicates a relationship between planets, creatively active in gnostic magick, and a way to draw energy from the unconscious mind.
The gnostic principle that everything in the universe is connected and continuous, meaning to know one thing is to know everything, and that nothing is ever outside one's powers.
A time when the God Legbha recognizes a magician and sends a 'pheonisme' (aspect) of himself to awaken in them the desire to sexually unite with Legbha, leading to initiations into very high worlds.
An unbroken chain of magickal experiences formed by all the pheonismes of magick, allowing the magician to pass from one level of experience to another, connected to the Nemirion.

Numbers 1-9 are seen as agencies or foci of black magick powers, representing sources of corruption, destruction, and wrongdoing. They form a hierarchy of evil and can be used as tools of radical evil.
Projections of the magician's lust, broadcast to specific places to gain power over individuals at the level of deepest lust within the Guzotte system.
A type of magickal machine operating on etheric energy, sensitive to magical fields, used to send or receive energy, built along the lines of magickal physics.

key_concepts.term: Inner Legbha Geometry of the Hyperspatial Time
key_concepts.definition: Legbha as the supreme deity of magickal systems, representing pure cosmic geometry (including space and time) and the mystery at the root of all beings. To know this power is to become Legbha and understand the union between inner geometry and the outer world.

Time-stations 'waking up' by Legbha, leading to the Damballah myth of four sun-sons, sexual fluid (logoi spermatikoi) containing gnostic teachings in logical forms. Each time-station has two logical forms, both male and female.

A complex method for understanding time and space, divided into areas and domains ruled by extra-terrestrial intelligences. The cosmic computer's logic governs these stations, manifesting differently across universes and revealed through the teachings of the Nemirion.
The Voudoo Gods, ancient Gods of Atlantis, currently being restored as objects of worldwide magick. They are Afro-Atlantean and distinct from elemental Houdoo spirits.
The French-Haitian name for the old brotherhood of Afro-Atlantean magicians, referring to the snake goddess of outer space and primordial creative energy (black energy/shakti).
A Haitian magickal word for appearances, inner and outer, that are actually powerful magickal objects or 'appearance-elementals.' Focusing on them reveals their powers.
Power zones within the human body and surroundings where occult powers build up, often unrecognized by magicians, and capable of developing their own will.
Magickal energies originating outside Pluto's orbit, from non-densely physical planets, representing the most extreme power zone of our solar system and a doorway to other systems.

Magickal beings inhabiting a planet with the star Rigel in Orion as its Sun. They are the race of beings in the oracular minds of Michael Bertiaux's people, extra-terrestrial semi-humanoids living on Earth through space-magick, and related to Medjis of IFA. The Zothyrians are a branch of the Nemirion.

An alternative universe that is a direct emanation of the Primordial Mother Goddess, whose magickal culture is based on conditions similar but distinct from Earth. Its philosophy provides a living initiatic structure, and its primordial energy is time.

key_concepts.term: Arithmosophical Reduction and Measurements of Ojas
key_concepts.definition: A method taught by the Nemirion for breaking down words into numbers 1-9 (their roots), where each word has a power level measured by space-beings. Human magicians are analyzed into collections of magickal numbers.

practical_system.description: The system is an operative framework for spiritual transformation and awakening, integrating Gnostic initiation, ritual magic, prayer, meditation, esoteric logic, and numerological practices. It aims to develop a 'Gnostic consciousness' to interact directly with divine beings and manipulate subtle energies for self-divinization and mastery over various energetic and ontological realms. It emphasizes a structured approach to self-purity and connection with diverse spiritual entities.
tools: Small piece of paper or index card for requests
rituals: Daily Gnostic Initiation Prayer for spiritual awareness (Page 1)
Ancient Prayer to soar to Heaven and contemplate all things (Page 1)
Special Power Projection for transformative powers (Page 4)
Daily Invocation to the Sun-Goddess for protection and power (Page 5)
Kami-Energization Prayer for unity with Kami-Nature (Page 6)
Simple Prayer for greeting ubiquitous Kami (Page 7)
Kami-Ritual for Purity involving spring water, sea salt, cloth, and specific prayers (Page 7-8)
Basic Ritual for Gaining from Hoodoo Spirits with candles and a written request (Page 16)
Magical Prayer to invoke Hoodoo spirits of love and sex (Page 13)
Meditational contact with Kami/deities using esoteric logic (Page 14)
Esoteric logic exercises for developing the magician's mind and understanding 'intuition-structure' (Page 10, 13)

relevant_quotes.text: However, what is important is that the more power the student has or the higher the power of the master, the more the name of the ruler of the world will be properly reflected in the oracle work. It is because the more powerful magicians are able to enter more and more deeply into the states of these rulers, indeed into the consciousness of these higher or more spiritual realms, and grasp what is there. This power can only come from the esoteric side of gnostic initiation.

I dwell in the golden temple and my power rises therein and is diffused in every part of the world. I send the rays of my power to every being and my word carries with it the light of the ages. I have sent the birds of dawn and they have become the messengers of my powers for I am the master of the rays.

I call upon you O My Divine Mother, the Goddess of the Sun, asking your protection and power to be with me at every moment of this day. I adore your presence in the light of the solar disc, I worship You in the divine Sun within my heart. When I say I am a son (daughter) of the Sun, I call upon You at all times. I adore your light, which is filling all space. I see You before me in the heavenly symbol. You are My Divine Mother, Ameratsu-Omni-Kami.

The Kami, or the Gods of the Shinto Religion, are the most powerful forces in the world. They are the purest and most ideal embodiments of natural forces and elemental power, as well as being the expressions of the divine intelligibility of all being. The religion of the future will be a form of Shinto, separated from its Japanese isolation and fused with many elementals from magick. This form of Shinto will be understood as the highest and most complete form of the Cult of the Vudu, for they are the same in essence.

True initiation is the process of realization, whereby we say to ourselves quite firmly that we are parts of the divine universe of all beings. Love is the ultimate reality and the universe is made up of pure lights, which have become fully aware of this power of love. Once one has tuned into this power, by actual mental and spiritual effort and not mechanically, you know that the high energies are now pouring through your soul and your body.

One of the most important ideas in the human consciousness is that of number. But for the magician this can only mean that numbers are the agencies of evil, or the foci of the black magick powers. We create a world around us with numbers. Everything is assigned its proper number and this means that numbers cover all manifested being, in one way or another.

critical_analysis.relevance: This work is highly relevant for advanced practitioners and scholars of esotericism, offering a unique syncretic system that bridges distinct magical traditions (Voudon, Shinto, Western Gnosticism) with complex philosophical underpinnings. It provides a detailed theoretical framework for spiritual evolution, cosmic interaction, and self-transformation, moving beyond simplistic magical concepts to address deep ontological and epistemological questions within a magical context.
critical_analysis.target_audience: Advanced students and practitioners of Western Esotericism, Occultism, and Gnostic Voudon. It is explicitly not for beginners, requiring a disciplined approach and prior understanding of complex magical and philosophical concepts.
